sn13.10:1.2: “Mendicants, suppose the Himalayas, the king of mountains, was worn away and eroded except for seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds.
sn13.10:1.4: Which is more: the portion of the Himalayas, the king of mountains, that has been worn away and eroded, or the seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds that are left?”
sn13.10:2.1: “Sir, the portion of the Himalayas, the king of mountains, that has been worn away and eroded is certainly more.
sn13.10:2.2: The seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds are tiny.
sn13.10:2.3: Compared to the Himalayas, it’s not nearly a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part.”
sn13.10:3.1: “In the same way, for a noble disciple accomplished in view, a person with comprehension, the suffering that’s over and done with is more,
sn13.10:3.3: Compared to the mass of suffering in the past that’s over and done with, it’s not nearly a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part, since there are at most seven more lives.
sn13.10:3.4: That’s how very beneficial it is to comprehend the teaching and gain the vision of the teaching.”
